metadata.Description: The rights of indigenous communities to own, use, and manage their traditional lands.

entities: un declaration on the rights of indigenous peoples

relations.Description: Indigenous land rights employ traditional ecological knowledge to manage and protect natural resources.
Indigenous land rights collaborate with local communities to ensure sustainable land management practices.
Indigenous land rights support cultural preservation to protect the heritage and traditions of indigenous communities.
Indigenous land rights administer land tenure systems to secure land rights for indigenous communities.
Indigenous land rights measure land stewardship to ensure sustainable use and conservation of natural resources.

relations.Object: un declaration on the rights of indigenous peoples
relations.Description: Indigenous land rights align with the UN Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples to protect the rights of indigenous communities.
Indigenous land rights are an instance of human rights, ensuring the rights of indigenous communities to their ancestral lands.

relations-level-2.Subject: traditional ecological knowledge
relations-level-2.Description: Traditional ecological knowledge addresses climate change adaptation by providing valuable insights and practices for sustainable resource management.

relations-level-2.Subject: traditional ecological knowledge
relations-level-2.Description: Traditional ecological knowledge employs agroecology principles to promote sustainable and resilient agricultural practices.

relations-level-2.Subject: traditional ecological knowledge
relations-level-2.Description: Traditional ecological knowledge collaborates with scientific research institutions to integrate traditional and scientific knowledge for sustainable resource management.

relations-level-2.Subject: traditional ecological knowledge
relations-level-2.Description: Traditional ecological knowledge supports biodiversity conservation efforts by providing insights into the relationships between species and ecosystems.

relations-level-2.Subject: traditional ecological knowledge
relations-level-2.Description: Traditional ecological knowledge administers community-based natural resource management initiatives that promote sustainable livelihoods and conservation.

relations-level-2.Subject: traditional ecological knowledge
relations-level-2.Description: Traditional ecological knowledge measures ecosystem health by assessing indicators such as species diversity, water quality, and soil fertility.

relations-level-2.Subject: traditional ecological knowledge
relations-level-2.Description: Traditional ecological knowledge aligns with indigenous rights by recognizing the importance of indigenous peoples' knowledge and practices in sustainable development.

relations-level-2.Subject: traditional ecological knowledge
relations-level-2.Description: Traditional ecological knowledge is recognized as an instance of intangible cultural heritage by UNESCO.

relations-level-3.Subject: indigenous land rights
relations-level-3.Description: Indigenous land rights employ traditional ecological knowledge to manage and protect natural resources.
